comments.creator: paul@oshannessy.com
comments.text:
This isn't a priority, but it might have some perceived performance wins. I think the wins may be pretty negligible at this point, so this may become WONTFIX at some point.

We already prioritize the selected tab and following that restore visible tabs before other tabs. It might make sense to instead restore tabs in MRU order instead.

comments.creator: nicolas.barbulesco@supinfo.com
comments.raw_text:
Paul, I don't know whether you speak of the restoration order of all tabs globally or the restoration order of the tabs within each window.

Currently, Firefox session restore preserves the window stack order. I mean : on Mac OS X, I have my bunch of Firefox windows, the front window is at the top of the stack, another window is just behind, and so on. After session restore, my stack of windows is restored with its order preserved. And this is good.
